entry.title: In Space, Anything Is Possible | Compilation

media:group.media:title: In Space, Anything Is Possible | Compilation
media:group.media:description:
What’s impossible today becomes possible tomorrow, and this is especially true in astronomy. Here are three videos about things we could only once imagine.
Hosts: Hank Green, Caitlin Hofmeister, Reid Reimers ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace
Or by checking out our awesome space pins and other products over at DFTBA Records: http://dftba.com/scishow ---------- Looking for SciShow elsewhere on the internet? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GcfF40CPdl0&ab_channel=SciShowSpace
White Holes: An Impossible Possibility
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y1HqOEbq2L4&ab_channel=SciShowSpace

entry.title: The Spacecraft That Wasn't Designed To Land, But Did

media:group.media:title: The Spacecraft That Wasn't Designed To Land, But Did
media:group.media:description:
Pre-order your NEAR Shoemaker pin all this month here: https://dftba.com/scishow
Many space missions take billions of dollars and decades of work to get develop, but 25 years ago this spacecraft delivered stunning results on a shoestring budget and a minimal development timeline.
Hosted by: Hank Green (he/him) ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace
Or by checking out our awesome space pins and other products over at DFTBA Records: http://dftba.com/scishow ---------- Looking for SciShow elsewhere on the internet? SciShow on TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@scishow SciShow Tangents Podcast: http://www.scishowtangents.org Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/scishow Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/scishow Instagram: http://instagram.com/thescishow ---------- Sources: https://www.space.com/james-webb-space-telescope-budget-timeline-scale https://www.jhuapl.edu/PressRelease/000314 https://www.nasa.gov/planetarymissions/discovery.html https://web.archive.org/web/20110301135255/http://discovery.nasa.gov/lib/pdf/HistoricalDiscoveryProgramInformation.pdf https://www.jhuapl.edu/PressRelease/001024 https://near.jhuapl.edu/media/NEAR_fact_sheet.pdf https://www.jhuapl.edu/PressRelease/960217 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/433_Eros#/media/File:Eros_orbit_2018.png https://solarsystem.nasa.gov/missions/near-shoemaker/in-depth https://near.jhuapl.edu/eros/sum.html&nbsp https://www.jhuapl.edu/PressRelease/970630 https://www.kiss.caltech.edu/workshops/csc2011/references/missions-to-neo/Near%20Earth%20Asteroid%20Rendezvous_Mission%20Summary_Cheng.pdf https://www.jhuapl.edu/PressRelease/970618 https://www.jhuapl.edu/PressRelease/970929 https://www.jhuapl.edu/PressRelease/97092 https://www.jhuapl.edu/PressRelease/970929 https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/pdf/10.1111/j.1945-5100.2001.tb01852.x
Image Sources: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:SpaceX_Crew_Dragon_(More_cropped).jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:James_Webb_Space_Telescope_2009_top.jpg https://solarsystem.nasa.gov/missions/near-shoemaker/in-depth/ https://images.nasa.gov/details-PIA22745 https://images.nasa.gov/details-PIA18163 https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:NEAR_Shoemaker_spacecraft_model.png https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:NEAR_Spacecraft_Configuration.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Launch_of_NEAR_on_a_Delta_II_7925-8.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Eros_-_PIA02923_(color).jpg https://solarsystem.nasa.gov/asteroids-comets-and-meteors/asteroids/253-mathilde/in-depth/ https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/images/pia02476-first-near-image-of-mathilde https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:PIA02467_NEAR%27s_First_Whole-Eros_Mosaic_from_Orbit.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:NEARCraft.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Animation_of_NEAR_Shoemaker_trajectory_around_433_Eros.gif https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Asteroid433eros.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Eros_rotation_Dec._3-4_2000.gif https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Erosregolith.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:NEARtrajectory.jpg https://images.nasa.gov/details-PIA03140 https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Near_Shoemaker.jpg

entry.title: How to Make a Dark Matter Planet

media:group.media:title: How to Make a Dark Matter Planet
media:group.media:description:
Dark Matter is the most abundant form of matter in the known universe, so what's keeping it from forming into planets?
Hosted by: Hank Green ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace
Or by checking out our awesome space pins and other products over at DFTBA Records: http://dftba.com/scishow ---------- Looking for SciShow elsewhere on the internet? SciShow on TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@scishow SciShow Tangents Podcast: http://www.scishowtangents.org Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/scishow Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/scishow Instagram: http://instagram.com/thescishow ---------- Sources:
https://journals.aps.org/prl/pdf/10.1103/PhysRevLett.120.051102 http://www.physicsmatt.com/blog/2017/7/13/paper-explainer-collapsed-dark-matter-structures https://www.space.com/dark-matter-planets-blown-up-detection https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S027311772100301X?via%3Dihub https://arxiv.org/pdf/2205.13386.pdf https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11038-019-09525-4 https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10509-016-2815-z https://benthamopen.com/contents/pdf/TOAAJ/TOAAJ-4-57.pdf https://astrobites.org/2011/04/10/dark-matter-and-planet-habitability/ https://www.fnal.gov/pub/today/archive/archive_2014/today14-08-15_NutshellReadMore.html https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/super-strong-electric-forces-may-have-helped-tiny-clumps-dust-seed-planets-180973756/
Images
https://www.nasa.gov/image-feature/jpl/pia20645/protoplanetary-disk/ https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/infographics/the-big-bang-and-expansion-of-the-universe https://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/imagegallery/image_feature_827.html https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_matter_halo#/media/File:Dark_matter_halo.png https://www.nasa.gov/feature/goddard/2016/understanding-the-magnetic-sun https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Artist%E2%80%99s_impression_of_the_expected_dark_matter_distribution_around_the_Milky_Way.ogv https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Fermi_Observations_of_Dwarf_Galaxies_Provide_New_Insights_on_Dark_Matter.ogv https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Artist%E2%80%99s_Impression_of_a_Baby_Star_Still_Surrounded_by_a_Protoplanetary_Disc.jpg https://www.eso.org/public/images/eso1301a/ https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:COSMOS_3D_dark_matter_map.png https://www.nasa.gov/image-feature/this-gas-giant-is-pretty-in-pink https://exoplanets.nasa.gov/eyes-on-exoplanets/?destinations=/alien-worlds/strange-new-worlds/#/planet/KELT-9_b/

entry.title: Great Minds: Conny Aerts, the Starquake Professor

media:group.media:title: Great Minds: Conny Aerts, the Starquake Professor
media:group.media:description:
This episode was made in partnership with The Kavli Prize. The Kavli Prize honors scientists for breakthroughs in astrophysics, nanoscience and neuroscience — transforming our understanding of the big, the small, and the complex.
While doing some light reading of data from a telescope, Conny Aerts made a breakthrough that allowed her to lead the charge in the field of asteroseismology and win her the 2022 Kavli Prize in Astrophysics.
Hosted by: Savannah Geary (they/them) ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace
Or by checking out our awesome space pins and other products over at DFTBA Records: http://dftba.com/scishow ---------- Looking for SciShow elsewhere on the internet? SciShow on TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@scishow SciShow Tangents Podcast: http://www.scishowtangents.org Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/scishow Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/scishow Instagram: http://instagram.com/thescishow ---------- Sources: https://orbi.uliege.be/bitstream/2268/76857/1/1926.pdf https://www.kavliprize.org/conny-aerts-autobiography https://www.kavliprize.org/bio/conny-aerts https://psycnet.apa.org/record/2020-72084-001 https://fys.kuleuven.be/ster/staff/conny-aerts https://arxiv.org/abs/2207.11051 https://journals.aps.org/rmp/abstract/10.1103/RevModPhys.93.015001 https://www.nature.com/articles/nature09935 https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1538-3873/aaeeec https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dveqFMamwyQ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sE2gDV3um4Y
Image Sources: https://www.kavliprize.org/bio/conny-aerts https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Telescopes_at_La_Silla.jpg https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/photo/space-galaxy-royalty-free-image/91713709?phrase=star%20space&adppopup=true https://www.kavliprize.org/prizes/astrophysics/2022 https://www.kavliprize.org/conny-aerts-autobiography https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:University_of_Antwerp_Hof_van_Liere.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Castle_Arenberg,_Katholieke_Universiteit_Leuven_adj.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Diagram_of_the_life_of_Sun-like_stars.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:太陽内部の定在波.PNG https://www.nasa.gov/feature/goddard/2021/nasa-s-new-hubble-focus-e-book-provides-a-front-row-seat-to-a-sky-full-of-stars https://exoplanets.nasa.gov/news/1516/symphony-of-stars-the-science-of-stellar-sound-waves/ https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/photo/close-up-of-acoustic-guitar-with-vibrating-strings-royalty-free-image/1264150890?phrase=guitar%20string&adppopup=true https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GjqvXVUWvEQ&t=166s https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/photo/lanzarote-night-sky-milky-way-royalty-free-image/653506436?phrase=bright%20star%20space&adppopup=true https://www.nasa.gov/content/goddard/sdo-mission-untangles-motion-inside-sun https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Telescope_Kepler-NASA.jpeg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Star_Life_Cycle_Chart.jpg https://www.nasa.gov/content/goddard/nasas-fermi-satellite-finds-hints-of-starquakes-in-magnetar-storm https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Gaia_observes_the_Milky_Way_ESA24305955.jpeg

entry.title: Why are Astronomers So Bad at Naming Things?

media:group.media:title: Why are Astronomers So Bad at Naming Things?
media:group.media:description:
With star names like 2MASS J05551028+0724255, it might seem like astronomers are not so great at naming things. But if you know the code, these names can actually help you find the star in the sky.
Hosted by: Reid Reimers ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace
Or by checking out our awesome space pins and other products over at DFTBA Records: http://dftba.com/scishow ---------- Looking for SciShow elsewhere on the internet? SciShow on TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@scishow SciShow Tangents Podcast: http://www.scishowtangents.org Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/scishow Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/scishow Instagram: http://instagram.com/thescishow ---------- Sources: https://www.iau.org/public/themes/naming_stars/ https://simbad.cds.unistra.fr/simbad/sim-id?Ident=HD+39801 https://cds.unistra.fr/cgi-bin/Dic-Simbad?BD%2b07 https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/1995yCat.1122....0A/abstract http://vizier.u-strasbg.fr/viz-bin/VizieR-3?-source=I/122/bd https://solarsystem.nasa.gov/basics/chapter2-2/ http://astro.unl.edu/naap/motion1/cec_units.html https://www.britannica.com/science/right-ascension https://skyandtelescope.org/astronomy-resources/right-ascension-declination-celestial-coordinates/ https://heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/W3Browse/all/bd.html https://www.iau.org/administration/about/ https://cdsweb.u-strasbg.fr/Dic/iau-spec.html
Images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Betelgeuse_captured_by_ALMA.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Orion_Head_to_Toe.jpg https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/illustration/orion-constellation-royalty-free-illustration/1203038669?phrase=betelgeuse&adppopup=true https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/photo/great-ocean-road-at-night-milky-way-view-royalty-free-image/498309616?phrase=stargazing&adppopup=true https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:AxialTiltObliquity.png https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/photo/orion-kenidjack-castle-cornwall-uk-royalty-free-image/1381725810?phrase=betelgeuse&adppopup=true https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/illustration/high-detailed-sky-maps-vector-set-royalty-free-illustration/859199494?phrase=star%20map&adppopup=true https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Simple_Constellation_Map.png https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Al-Sufi%27s_Orion,_1125_Baghdad_copy,_Doha_Museum_of_Islamic_Art_Ms_2._1998._SO.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Dunhuang_Star_Atlas_-_Orion.jpg https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/photo/star-map-of-northern-hemisphere-royalty-free-image/157280056?phrase=star%20map&adppopup=true https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Orion_IAU.svg https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/illustration/orion-constellation-vector-illustration-with-royalty-free-illustration/1061064662?phrase=betelgeuse&adppopup=true https://svs.gsfc.nasa.gov/20339 https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Eta_Cassiopeiae.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:South_Celestial_Pole.ogv

entry.title: How to Supersize a Telescope | Compilation

media:group.media:title: How to Supersize a Telescope | Compilation
media:group.media:description:
Telescopes can get pretty big, incredibly big actually. Unbelievably big. So here's a compilation about how we managed to get them that size and how that size helps us to see.
Hosted by: Savannah Geary (they/them) ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!

entry.title: How Do You Date a Star?

media:group.media:title: How Do You Date a Star?
media:group.media:description:
Start building your ideal daily routine! The first 100 people who click on the link will get 25% OFF Fabulous Premium: https://thefab.co/scishowspace9
Figuring out the age of a blinking speck in the sky is a difficult feat, especially if considering how many types of stars there are. This is where a Hertzsprung-Russell meets a gyrochronologist.
Hosted by: Savannah Geary (they/them) ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace
Or by checking out our awesome space pins and other products over at DFTBA Records: http://dftba.com/scishow ---------- Looking for SciShow elsewhere on the internet? SciShow on TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@scishow SciShow Tangents Podcast: http://www.scishowtangents.org Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/scishow Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/scishow Instagram: http://instagram.com/thescishow ---------- Sources: Interview with Eric Jensen from Swarthmore College https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IuKZjVlkXRQ https://chandra.harvard.edu/edu/formal/variable_stars/bg_info.html https://www.ucolick.org/~bolte/AY4/notes9/node2.html https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.3847/1538-4357/ac6035 https://astronomy.swin.edu.au/cosmos/m/main+sequence+lifetime https://arxiv.org/pdf/0704.3068.pdf
Image Sources: https://images.nasa.gov/details-PIA19341 https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:The_star_cluster_Messier_18_and_its_surroundings.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:HRDiagram.png https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:A_Hertzsprung–Russell_chart_of_stellar_evolution_(PSF).png https://hubblesite.org/contents/media/videos/2010/28/647-Video.html?news=true https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Hertzsprung-Russell_Diagram_-_ESO.png https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/photo/the-sun-royalty-free-image/520222808?phrase=the%20sun%20in%20space&adppopup=true https://www.researchgate.net/figure/Rotation-periods-of-the-Praesepe-blue-and-the-Hyades-orange-star-clusters-derived-by_fig9_338899735 https://svs.gsfc.nasa.gov/13641 https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:HRDiagram.png https://www.loc.gov/resource/gdcwdl.wdl_18412/?sp=48&st=image&r=-0.793,-0.178,2.587,1.653,0 https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Suzhou_star_cartography.jpg https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Betelgeuse_(star).jpg https://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/hubble/science/stellar_ages.html https://hubblesite.org/contents/media/images/2004/16/1534-Image.html?news=true

entry.title: The One-Second Success Story of Venera 7

media:group.media:title: The One-Second Success Story of Venera 7
media:group.media:description:
Venus may have been named after the Roman goddess of beauty, but once humans started sending spacecraft to the planet next door, we quickly learned that beauty… hurts. Get your own Venera 7 pin at DFTBA Records: http://dftba.com/scishow
Hosted by: Savannah Geary ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace
Or by checking out our awesome space pins and other products over at DFTBA Records: http://dftba.com/scishow ---------- Looking for SciShow elsewhere on the internet? entry.title: Goodbye, SOFIA, the Telescope That Actually Flew

media:group.media:title: Goodbye, SOFIA, the Telescope That Actually Flew
media:group.media:description:
In 1997, NASA bought a Boeing 747SP for what might be both a super cool and super absurd purpose. Turn it into SOFIA, a flying telescope.
Hosted by: Savannah Geary (they/them) ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace
Or by checking out our awesome space pins and other products over at DFTBA Records: http://dftba.com/scishow ---------- Looking for SciShow elsewhere on the internet? SciShow on TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@scishow SciShow Tangents Podcast: http://www.scishowtangents.org Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/scishow Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/scishow Instagram: http://instagram.com/thescishow ---------- Sources:
https://www.worldscientific.com/doi/pdf/10.1142/S225117171840010X [PDF] https://www.worldscientific.com/doi/full/10.1142/S225117171840007X https://www.sofia.usra.edu/sites/default/files/Other/Documents/science_case-final.pdf [PDF] https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-1-4419-9302-1_14 https://www.sofia.usra.edu/sites/default/files/97-Whiting_AeroHistory.pdf [PDF] https://www.sofia.usra.edu/sites/default/files/Other/Documents/OH-Cycle6.pdf [PDF] https://www.spiedigitallibrary.org/conference-proceedings-of-spie/4857/0000/The-SOFIA-aircraft-and-its-modification/10.1117/12.472490.short https://www.dglr.de/publikationen/2015/370363.pdf [PDF] https://www.gauss-centre.eu/results/computational-and-scientific-engineering/simulation-of-the-unsteady-flow-around-the-stratospheric-observatory-for-infrared-astronomy-sofia https://ntrs.nasa.gov/api/citations/19670004876/downloads/19670004876.pdf [PDF] https://www.dsi.uni-stuttgart.de/forschende/texte/ejp_0143-0807_34_6_S161.pdf [PDF] https://oig.nasa.gov/docs/IG-20-022.pdf [PDF] https://www.nasa.gov/feature/nasa-partner-decide-to-conclude-sofia-mission

entry.title: Goodbye SOFIA, Thanks for All the Discoveries

media:group.media:title: Goodbye SOFIA, Thanks for All the Discoveries
media:group.media:description:
SOFIA or The Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy is coming to an end, but let's look back on some of the amazing discoveries of this flying telescope.
Hosted by: Hank Green (He/Him) ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace

entry.title: What Will It Be Like To Live on the Moon? | Compilation

media:group.media:title: What Will It Be Like To Live on the Moon? | Compilation
media:group.media:description:
The Moon is pretty prime real estate once you get past the lack of oxygen, resources, and general mobility, but if quality of life isn't what you're after, here's how we might make it all work.
Hosted by: Reid Reimers (he/him) ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!

media:group.media:title: How to Move the Sky
media:group.media:description:
The earth is always moving, and our view of the night sky is slowly but surely changing.
Hosted by: Reid Reimers (He/Him) ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
Support SciShow Space by becoming a patron on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SciShowSpace

media:group.media:title: Putting Pulsars To Work | Compilation
media:group.media:description:
Humans are pretty good at inventing things to help us wrap our brains around the things surrounding us. But pulsars are provided by nature, so we’ve put them to work helping us understand more about the universe they we inhabit.
Hosted by: Hank Green (he/him) ---------- Huge thanks go to the following Patreon supporter for helping us keep SciShow Space free for everyone forever: Jason A Saslow, David Brooks, and AndyGneiss!
